skill.name: agile-product-owner
skill.description: Agile product ownership toolkit for Senior Product Owner including INVEST-compliant user story generation, sprint planning, backlog management, and velocity tracking. Use for story writing, sprint planning, stakeholder communication, and agile ceremonies.
skill.summary: Agile product ownership toolkit for Senior Product Owner including INVEST-compliant user story gener...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

content.value_statement: An AI skill for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
actual_capabilities: Generate INVEST-compliant user stories from epics with automatic acceptance criteria
Perform sprint capacity planning with velocity tracking and team capacity management
Create and prioritize product backlogs with automatic point estimation
Break down epics into well-formed user stories with persona-based templates
Generate acceptance criteria using Given-When-Then and behavioral patterns
Track sprint metrics and velocity for data-driven planning
limitations: Requires manual review of generated stories to ensure business context accuracy
Story point estimates are automated and may need adjustment based on team velocity
Does not integrate directly with project management tools like Jira or Azure DevOps
Sprint planning assumes standard Scrum methodology and may need adaptation for other frameworks
Persona templates are predefined and may not cover all specialized user types

use_cases.title: Epic Breakdown
use_cases.description: Break down large epics into manageable user stories with acceptance criteria for sprint planning
use_cases.target_user: Product Owners preparing backlog refinement sessions

use_cases.title: Sprint Planning
use_cases.description: Plan sprint capacity and select stories based on team velocity and available capacity
use_cases.target_user: Scrum teams during sprint planning ceremonies

use_cases.title: Backlog Management
use_cases.description: Prioritize and estimate product backlog items with INVEST criteria validation
use_cases.target_user: Product Owners maintaining healthy product backlogs

use_cases.title: Story Template Generation
use_cases.description: Generate consistent user story formats using persona-based templates for different user types
use_cases.target_user: Product teams establishing story writing standards

prompt_templates.title: Generate User Stories from Epic
prompt_templates.prompt: I have an epic: [describe epic]. Generate INVEST-compliant user stories with acceptance criteria for personas: end user, admin, and power user.
prompt_templates.scenario: Breaking down a large feature into sprint-ready stories

prompt_templates.title: Plan Sprint Capacity
prompt_templates.prompt: My team has [X] story points capacity for the next sprint. Help me select and prioritize stories from the backlog to maximize value delivery.
prompt_templates.scenario: Sprint planning with team capacity constraints

prompt_templates.title: Create Acceptance Criteria
prompt_templates.prompt: For the user story: [story description], generate comprehensive acceptance criteria using Given-When-Then format.
prompt_templates.scenario: Defining testable acceptance criteria for stories

prompt_templates.title: Validate INVEST Criteria
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this user story and validate it against INVEST criteria (Independent, Negotiable, Valuable, Estimable, Small, Testable): [story text]
prompt_templates.scenario: Ensuring story quality before sprint commitment

output_examples.input: Generate a user story for a login feature for end users
output_examples.output:
As an End User, I want to log in securely with my credentials so that I can access my personalized dashboard.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given valid credentials, When I submit the login form, Then I am redirected to my dashboard
- Should display error message when credentials are invalid
- Must encrypt password during transmission to ensure security
- Can reset password without losing account access

Estimated Points: 5
Priority: High

output_examples.input: Plan a sprint with 40 story points capacity
output: 3. Export Data Feature (8 points) - Medium Priority
Velocity Tracking: Previous sprint 38 points, Current plan 39 points

best_practices: Always validate user stories against INVEST criteria before committing to a sprint
Include multiple personas (end user, admin, power user) when breaking down epics to ensure comprehensive coverage
Use Given-When-Then format for acceptance criteria to ensure testability and clarity
Maintain 10-15% capacity buffer in sprint planning to account for unknowns and technical debt
Track velocity across sprints to improve estimation accuracy and planning reliability
Review and refine generated stories with stakeholders to ensure business value alignment
anti_patterns: Accepting AI-generated stories without reviewing for business context and domain accuracy
Over-committing sprint capacity by ignoring velocity trends and historical data
Creating overly technical stories that don't articulate clear user value or business benefit
Skipping persona consideration and writing generic stories that don't address specific user needs
Neglecting to validate INVEST criteria, leading to stories that are too large or lack clear acceptance criteria
Using automated point estimates without team calibration and consensus

faq.question: How does the tool ensure stories follow INVEST criteria?
faq.answer: The generator validates each story against INVEST principles: Independent (no dependencies), Negotiable (flexible scope), Valuable (clear benefit), Estimable (can be sized), Small (fits in sprint), and Testable (has acceptance criteria). Stories are automatically structured with persona-based templates and acceptance criteria patterns.

faq.question: Can I customize the personas and story templates?
faq.answer: Yes, the user_story_generator.py script includes predefined personas (end_user, admin, power_user, new_user) and story templates that can be extended. You can modify the personas dictionary and story_templates to match your product's specific user types and organizational standards.

faq.question: How are story points estimated automatically?
faq.answer: The tool uses complexity indicators like number of acceptance criteria, integration requirements, and persona scope to suggest story points. These automated estimates should be reviewed and adjusted by the team during backlog refinement based on their velocity and technical context.

faq.question: What sprint planning features are included?
faq.answer: The sprint planning mode allows you to specify team capacity in story points and automatically selects and prioritizes stories to maximize value delivery within that capacity. It tracks velocity, maintains capacity buffers, and provides sprint metrics for data-driven planning.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my existing project management tools?
faq.answer: The tool generates structured JSON output that can be imported into tools like Jira, Azure DevOps, or Trello through their APIs or CSV import features. While not a direct integration, the standardized output format facilitates easy data transfer to your preferred platform.
